title: Tahith Chong admits tough Manchester United first-team introduction
text:
Tahith Chong has revealed he has found the step up into the Manchester United first-team a tough experience but is relishing further chances to impress under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.

Chong is among a crop of United youngsters including Angel Gomes, Mason Greenwood and Brandon Williams who have been handed more first-team opportunities since the Norwegian took charge.

Indeed it was under Solskjaer he made his debut, featuring in an FA Cup win against Reading at the start of the year.

Tahith Chong made his Manchester United debut against Reading at the start of the year

The 19-year-old has since gained minutes playing in the Champions League, Premier League, Europa League and the FA Cup and feels he is constantly adapting to the demands expected of him at Old Trafford.

'All of us really, just there now, are having a lot of learning curves and are gaining a lot of experience up to now,' he told Manchester United's website. 'It has been amazing really and, just thinking about it, being a first-team player, is something you dream about. The younger lads coming up as well, so it's really good.

'Training is a different level as well now. Definitely, the training and the games are tougher, stuff like that, as you progress, but you keep training and keep playing games and you'll get there. You start getting used to the tempo to the game and, like I've said, it's been a good experience for us.'

Chong admits his step up into the first-team has been a tough but valuable experience

The winger's most high profile appearance came in last season's clash at Paris Saint-Germain

Chong's most high profile appearance so far came in United's stunning win at Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League in March.

The winger appeared for the final 10 minutes of the encounter during which United scored a dramatic late winner to progress to the quarter-finals. Rather than be daunted by the occasion though, Chong states he quickly settled into the game.

'It is one of the things you get used to,' he added. 'The tempo coming into the game as well. The tempo is already there and, it’s 'OK, now I’m coming on, I’ve got to get used to it and get into the game straight away'. It’s all a learning experience and I’m really enjoying it.'

Chong has already featured four times for United this term, including in the last round of the League Cup against Rochdale, and will hope for more minutes in the last-16 of the competition when his side visit Chelsea on Wednesday.
